alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, EAST CENTRAL DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 410 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Tolar, or 17 miles east of Fort Sumner, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... House, Ragland, Tolar, Mcalister and Forrest. This includes Highway 60 near Mile Marker 346, and between Mile Markers 348 and 349. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
